attributes.comment:
Dear Sir/Madam.

It is very good to know and nice to observe that there is some real thought process
in-place for the Immigration policy and regulations. But it would have been really
appreciated very much by millions of beneficiary, employers and law-firm if this
thought process has been made in the most current demanding needs of today,
which is to reduce the undue processing delays in various stages of Immigration
say filing RIR (LC), I-140 and I-485.

But it was very unfortunate to know that most of the fees related to Immigration
services are proposed to be increased considerably. Keeping the turn around time
in mind for processing various cases say I-140 (turn around time for regular
processing is close to 6-7 months), I-485 (turn around time for processing varying
from 3-12 months once the priority date becomes current) it doesn't warranty any
need to increase the cost of any immigration service provided by USCIS.

It is very much understood that the process in certifying any Immigration case has
become complicated these days due to the tight security measure. But more than
the security measure it is the resource crunch at various USCIS centers and slow
processing are the main factors pushing things in a wrong direction for not getting
things done in timely fashion by USCIS.

Please make every effort to make things better to improve the processing time
involved in various stages of Immigration. I believe, if things moves faster there
would not be any concern from beneficiary, law-firm or employer rather everyone
would support the increase in cost of Immigration.

So the think tank behind this Immigration policy, should spend sufficient time in
evolving a decent timeframe for all these process. It would benefit many of the
LEGAL immigrants who are working for the good cause of this country's economy.

Keeping in mind the jobs which have started moving to the other parts of the world,
I think to remain competent and competitive is the only way to get around any
concerns or problems. Any steps taken other than that would be a very bad
decision in long term. So please think in terms of long term goals rather short term
goals like increasing the prices of immigration while the service outcome is very
bad. Instead, the current trend of immigration processing demands reducing the
cost from the existing price.

"In general the common sense would be to increase the cost if and only if there is
any quality of service provided". I would appreciate that USCIS to be a good trend
setter and not be a wrong doer.

Thanks
